summary: The 'Maximum Support Act' (HR 2614) aims to support internet freedom and counter censorship in Iran. It mandates strategies and programs to provide secure internet access, counter regime surveillance, and aid Iranian dissidents. The bill also proposes confiscating Iranian government assets, strategically using sanctions, and encouraging defections from the Iranian government. Furthermore, it calls for designating the Iranian Ministry of Intelligence as a Foreign Terrorist Organization and provides cybersecurity assistance to dissidents.
